question: Were there any traditions in your childhood that you hope to pass on to future generations?
How did your relationship with your body develop during your youth?
What core values were instilled in you at a young age?
How were mistakes or failures treated in your family growing up?
Were you free to explore your interests, or were there constraints?
Did you ever rebel against your parents? In what way?
Who were your childhood heroes outside of your family?

How did your parents’ or caregivers’ work ethics shape your own?
